prompt: FLOWROLL stops working when I change the model’s time range. Why would adjusting the global time range break rolling windows?
completion: Those removed periods were likely part of earlier windows.

prompt: DIMMATCH aligns most items but skips the ones created late in the year. Why only late-year items?
completion: Add hierarchy relationships to include them in DIMMATCH.

prompt: FLOWROLL gives me the same value across 12 periods even though the inputs vary. Why is it flat?
completion: That rolling window produces strong smoothing.

prompt: DIMMATCH alignment works but drops items that are inactive. Why does DIMMATCH ignore inactive members?
completion: Include them to retain their alignment.

prompt: FLOWROLL outputs shrink drastically when I move from monthly to daily data. Why?
completion: A 30-day window is much narrower than a 30-month window.

prompt: DIMMATCH refuses to align two lists that both roll up to the same top-level parent. Why does that matter?
completion: Those differences block structural alignment.

prompt: FLOWROLL seems to produce values offset by two periods. What could cause a two-period shift?
completion: Normalize period labels for correct sorting.

prompt: DIMMATCH duplicates rows when my mapping table has multiple valid targets. Is that expected?
completion: Resolve many-to-many mappings or aggregate first.

prompt: FLOWROLL returns different results after I added fiscal weeks. Why?
completion: Irregular period lengths change rolling window composition.

prompt: DIMMATCH deletes some values entirely when aligning to a list subset. Why deletion?
completion: Use the full list for alignment, filter later.

prompt: FLOWROLL collapses to zero when all previous periods are removed. Why?
completion: That is not enough to form multi-period windows.

prompt: DIMMATCH seems to partially align but leaves some items unmatched even though the names match. Why?
completion: Synchronizing codes will fix the issue.

prompt: FLOWROLL spikes on one line item only. What would cause a spike for one but not others?
completion: That adjustment drives the spike.

prompt: DIMMATCH won’t align a calculated item even though it shares the same list. Why not?
completion: LOOKUP modified the dimensionality.

prompt: FLOWROLL goes blank if one period is text instead of numeric. Is that normal?
completion: Clean or convert before rolling.

prompt: DIMMATCH reverses the order of members when aligning. Why reversed?
completion: That explains the reversed output.

prompt: FLOWROLL fails silently when using a large PeriodCount. Why no error?
completion: That results in blanket blanks.

prompt: DIMMATCH shrinks my dataset dramatically after I update the mapping table. Why smaller now?
completion: That consolidation reduces the dimensional output.

prompt: FLOWROLL produces identical outputs when I input a steady increasing trend. Why no visible growth?
completion: Larger changes would be needed to move the rolling totals noticeably.

prompt: DIMMATCH aligns correctly but raises warnings about orphan members. What are orphans?
completion: Assign parents to remove the warnings.

prompt: FLOWROLL drops sharply mid-year after a data cleanup. Why would cleanup cause a mid-year drop?
completion: Those inflated values previously boosted mid-year windows.

prompt: DIMMATCH refuses to align two lists that differ only in one missing parent. Should one parent matter that much?
completion: Restore the parent to re-enable alignment.

prompt: FLOWROLL produces negative windows even though all input values are positive. How?
completion: Those offsets cause negative rolling sums.

prompt: DIMMATCH realigns values to the wrong product family after I edited hierarchy. Why misalignment?
completion: Update the mapping to reflect the new structure.

prompt: FLOWROLL produces different values for two time lists that appear identical. Why?
completion: That changes all rolling windows.

prompt: DIMMATCH output is blank only for the last period. Why not earlier ones?
completion: Add mapping for it.

prompt: FLOWROLL outcomes double when I duplicate the series. Why exactly double?
completion: None. It scales proportionally.

prompt: DIMMATCH seems to scramble ordering inside the output. Why scrambled?
completion: Sorting the Target list will resolve output ordering.

prompt: FLOWROLL fails for a custom fiscal calendar with period names like 'W1', 'W2', etc. Should that work?
completion: Correct chronological ordering is required.

prompt: DIMMATCH unexpectedly expands single Territory values across multiple stores. Why that expansion?
completion: Hence the expanded output.

prompt: FLOWROLL produces inconsistent results after importing a CSV with custom ordering. Why?
completion: Reorder the imported data chronologically.

prompt: DIMMATCH shows alignment but values vanish for some branches. Why vanish?
completion: Use leaf-to-leaf mapping for full preservation.

prompt: FLOWROLL decreases sharply whenever a large early value drops out. Why so sharp?
completion: Its removal explains the sharp decrease.

prompt: DIMMATCH fails when aligning a calculated item that references two hierarchies. Why?
completion: Align each dimension separately.

prompt: FLOWROLL seems to ignore updated values in the tail periods. Why no effect at the end?
completion: Only windows that include that period update.

prompt: DIMMATCH realigns values but summary totals differ from before. Is that expected?
completion: Expansion increases summary totals unless adjusted.
